channel.title: Axe of Zorak's Rings ( Thanks Thathomonoob for name)
channel.description: This is an axe. Yes I know it's handle is long, but I don't care because... well I don't know. Any ideas on how to make it better? [img]http://i618.photobucket.com/albums/tt269/thedouchebagger/axe.jpg[/img] V2 [img]http://i618.photobucket.com/albums/tt269/thedouchebagger/axe-1.jpg[/img]

3ds max is a great program because you have all of these effects that make primitives look awesome. so even an unexpieirenced moddeler can look decent using prims on 3ds of blender

item.title: Axe of Zorak's Rings ( Thanks Thathomonoob for name)
item.dc:creator: @wayzey wayzey
item.description:
@wayzey wrote:

ak226688:

how do u make stuff out of cubes?

You use effects such as subserf, extrude and you give the cube segments. Like in my head shown above I gave the cube 4 segments for each axis. It’s much easier to do on blender, Max 3DS or another good 3D modeling program though so yer. I only made face to show difference between placing primitives and primitive modeling.

Read full topic

item.source: Axe of Zorak's Rings ( Thanks Thathomonoob for name)

item.title: Axe of Zorak's Rings ( Thanks Thathomonoob for name)
item.dc:creator: @T33J4Y T33J4Y
item.description:
@T33J4Y wrote:

[quote=“wayzey, post:8, topic:282412”]Er T33J4Y sorry but that’s not primitive modelling

That’s just placing unediting primitives at various sizes. I guess you could call it primitive modelling but it’s as basic as you can get.

Metaseq isn’t very good for primitive modelling in Meta there aren’t many effects and it’s real flimsy.
I had a lil go at just making a cube into a face and heres what I had after about 15 minutes:

See what i’ve done there, I started with a cube and sculpted it into that, that’s primitive modelling.[/quote]
Oh, lol. Well then I guess you could say this sucks.

Read full topic
item.source: Axe of Zorak's Rings ( Thanks Thathomonoob for name)

item.title: Axe of Zorak's Rings ( Thanks Thathomonoob for name)
item.dc:creator: @wayzey wayzey
item.description:
@wayzey wrote:

Er T33J4Y sorry but that’s not primitive modelling

That’s just placing unediting primitives at various sizes. I guess you could call it primitive modelling but it’s as basic as you can get.

Metaseq isn’t very good for primitive modelling in Meta there aren’t many effects and it’s real flimsy.
I had a lil go at just making a cube into a face and heres what I had after about 15 minutes:

See what i’ve done there, I started with a cube and sculpted it into that, that’s primitive modelling.

Read full topic
item.source: Axe of Zorak's Rings ( Thanks Thathomonoob for name)

item.title: Axe of Zorak's Rings ( Thanks Thathomonoob for name)
item.dc:creator: @T33J4Y T33J4Y
item.description:
@T33J4Y wrote:

[quote=“jjones10, post:6, topic:282412”]Okay good =] now critisism. haha sorry. But how would you swing that? it would hurt because you have to reach between the rings. Also it looks like a bunch of primitives. besides the head which is very basic.
Other than those critiques, its good[/quote]
Haha. Gotta steal my thunda. Well to tell the truth I hadn’t thought about that, although the rings aren’t connected to the pole so maybe they’re magical and you can put your hand through them (on v2 I’ll make them with less Apha). And it IS all primitives (was seeing what I could make using primitive modeling) besides the axe head.

Read full topic
